answers.answer: My guess: he'll have to see his ophthalmologist. It could be PCO, that is the back of the capsule that his original lens was sitting in gets cloudy in some people over time. Could be months may be years after the original surgery. Can easily be corrected with Laser surgery. My cataract surgery was a year ago, nothing yet - same age by the way.
Only an exam by an Eye MD will give the answers. Return to the cataract surgeon.JCH III MD

question: My dad 71 years of age had a successful catract operation around 2 years back., but recently his vision has started  diminishing in both eyes. Has high blood presure but quite under control, No diabetes. is it age related degeneration or else. Advice sought
title: degeneration of vision, after catract IOL implant
